Title: PREDICTING SOFTWARE DEFECTS WITH CAUSALITY TESTS
Purpose: Defect prediction approach and new tool
UseOF-SZZ: each bug b is linked to the classes changed to fix b
Summary:
a defect prediction approach centered on more robust evidences towards causality between source code metrics (as 
    predictors) and the occurrence of defects
Outcome:
reached an average precision greater than 50% in three out of the four systems we evaluated. Moreover, 
    by comparing our approach with baselines that are not based on causality tests, it achieved a better precision.
